org.usfirst.frc2022.subsystems

Class PWM_Generic

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • org.usfirst.frc2022.subsystems.PWM_Generic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamedSendable, Sendable, Drive_Generic

    public class PWM_Generic
extends Subsystem
implements Drive_Generic
    Generic PWM subsystem used for the drivebase.
    Author:
    Titan Robotics (2022), Michael Hrcek

    • Constructor Detail

      • PWM_Generic

        public PWM_Generic(Jaguar[] newJags)
        Constructor for the subsystem. Check for an even number of jaguars. If there are an even number of jaguars, use them. Otherwise, tell the driver to add more jaguars.
        Parameters:
        jags - Array of jaguars used for controlling the drivebase

      • PWM_Generic

        public PWM_Generic(int[] ports)
        Constructor for the subsystem. Check for an even number of ports. If there are an even number of ports, create new jaguars at those ports. Otherwise, tell the driver to assign an even number of ports to the robot.
        Parameters:
        ports - Array of ints storing the ports used by the Jaguars

        public void drive(double speed)
        Set the speed of all the motors. Only allows for forward and backward movement.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • drive

        public void drive(double speedLeft,
         double speedRight)
        Set the speed of the motors. Each side can be set to a different speed. Useful for a tank drive.
        Specified by:
        drive in interface Drive_Generic
        Parameters:
        speedLeft - The speed of the left motors
        speedRight - The speed of the right motors

      • driveMecanum

        public void driveMecanum(double speedLeftFront,
                double speedRightFront,
                double speedLeftBack,
                double speedRightBack)
        Designed for use in mecanum drives. Set the speed for each motor. Must have exactly 4 motors.
        Parameters:
        speedLeftFront - Speed of the front left wheel
        speedRightFront - Speed of the front right wheel
        speedLeftBack - Speed of the back left wheel
        speedRightBack - Speed of the back right wheel
